intro: Ocotea carchiensis, commonly known as the Carchi ocotea, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the cloud forests of western Colombia. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and smooth, gray bark. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations between 1,200 and 2,500 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Ocotea carchiensis plays a vital ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
